intro: Onychium moupinense, commonly known as the Moupin onychium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible or medicinal properties. The plant features upright, branched stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, typically displaying shades of pink or purple. Onychium moupinense is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for potential medicinal uses in traditional medicine.
